column4: I used apt-get install libpng2, and apt-get install libpng3, and I still get the following error:
configure: WARNING: libpng not found.  PNG support will not be compiled.
any suggestions on how to fix this?
ok I have two more questions
how do I mount an ntfs partition for read (and perhaps write)
NTFS support on Linux is barely working.
I want to read some files and copy them over without using a third media
use "df -h" to tell you what /dev/ to use.
no, grub does all its magic at boot time.
